org.jpasecurity

Interface SecurityContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRoleBasedSecurityContext, AutodetectingSecurityContext, CdiSecurityContext, DefaultSecurityContext, EjbSecurityContext, JsfSecurityContext, SpringSecurityContext, StaticSecurityContext

    public interface SecurityContext
    This interface may be implemented to provide details about the current security context like authentication credentials and so. If the SecurityContext needs information about the configured persistence information like entity mapping information or persistence properties, it may also implement the org.jpasecurity.mapping.MappingInformationReceiver interface to get this information injected during runtime.
    Author:
    Arne Limburg

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<Alias> getAliases()
      Returns a collection of all aliases that may be used in access rules, i.e.
      Object getAliasValue(Alias alias)
      Returns the current value of the specified alias.
      <T> Collection<T> getAliasValues(Alias alias)
      Returns the current value of the specified collection-valued alias.

    • Method Detail

      • getAliases

        Collection<Alias> getAliases()
        Returns a collection of all aliases that may be used in access rules, i.e. CURRENT_PRINCIPAL, CURRENT_ROLES or CURRENT_TENANT.

      • getAliasValue

        Object getAliasValue(Alias alias)
        Returns the current value of the specified alias. JPA Security will determine from the usage of an alias in an access rule if an alias is collection-valued, that means if the value of an alias is a collection (i.e. CURRENT_ROLES) or not. If the value of an alias is a collection, this method will not be called, but getAliasValues(Alias) will be called instead.

      • getAliasValues

        <T> Collection<T> getAliasValues(Alias alias)
        Returns the current value of the specified collection-valued alias. JPA Security will determine from the usage of an alias in an access rule if an alias is collection-valued, that means if the value of an alias is a collection (i.e. CURRENT_ROLES) or not. Only in the case that the alias is collection-valued, this method will be called, otherwise getAliasValue(Alias) will be called.
